note.p: Career: Travelled in Greece, Spain and Portugal; Assistant Surgeon to British Squadron at Lisbon (joined 1807); retired on half pay (1813); worked as translator, interpreter and courier to the Foreign Office; took up study of medicine again, especially interested in midwifery; had a large practice as accoucheur; visited Russia professionally (1827 and 1849); interested in spas, and practised in Kissingen for a part of each year; published "The Royal Society in the 19th century ..." (1836)
